rules.ruleString: Must be enrolled in course type {04, 05, 06, 06G, 06PG, 07G, 07PG} owned by {50000567}
For COURSE_CODE IN {3387, L6005} Do Must have passed 72 credit points Otherwise true

time: Summer semester A (starts November) 2017 (On-campus block of classes)

description: The unit examines key aspects of the Commonwealth tax system. It introduces taxation theory and policy and the constitutional and administrative framework within which the federal tax system operates. The unit examines: goods and services tax, income tax and deductions, capital gains tax, corporate and shareholder taxation, and the taxation of superannuation contributions and investments. The unit focuses on the practical application of the taxation law to common commercial transactions.
